title: Merrimac Ferry open for business
maintext:
One of the surest signs of spring has started going back and forth across the Wisconsin River.
The Merrimac Ferry, connecting the ends of Highway 113 between Merrimac and Okee, has started running again, bringing cars, bikes and pedestrians across the river 24 hours a day, seven days a week.
The free ferry will run until ice forms on the river sometime in late fall.
The ferryâ€™s official name is COLSAC III, the name a combination of Columbia County, where Okee is, and Sauk County, where Merrimac is.
In 2017, the craft made 63,209 trips across the river, carrying 284,133 vehicles. It takes about seven minutes to cross the river, the ferry running along three underwater cables.
Ferry service at that location started about 170 years ago. The ferry is owned and operated by the Wisconsin Department of Transportation.
For more information, go online to the DOT webpage.
